review_title: Magic At My Fingertips and Deep Strategy
one_reviews_text:
Playing through Acolytes single player campaign, I was blown away by how great this feels to play. I'm an anime fan; this felt like wielding magic for real just like in the shows, including needing to think on my feet. 

The community discord is incredibly helpful especially as you learn to duel. Online pvp duels happen every Saturday at 2pm-4pm US Eastern, and are active as of March 2020 - there are always people playing during that time window! Join us!  (Alternate times are available by asking on Discord.)  There's also The Unspoken Fandom Wiki with tons of detailed information and links to stream videos.

The team that built this moved on to Stormlands next (it's great too). The Unspoken isn't receiving software updates, but it still plays great, and there's an active (and newly growing) player base.  It works with Quest + Link cable.

The really rich game play happens in online duels against other players.  They'll welcome beginners, teach you techniques that the tutorials don't mention, and help you learn the depth of strategy and combo moves you can do as each class.  The game is a brilliant mix of thoughtful strategy and fast reflexes (the better you are at strategy, the less critical reflexes become).  It's a very welcoming community of players who deeply love the game and play for fun (and yes, we have some women among advanced players!).  

Top players still participate on chat and in game on a regular basis, sharing strategies and tips. Beginner and intermediate players provide a more suitable duel for beginners and are also available for regular games.  Games are arranged through the The Unspoken Discord, #looking_for_game channel, out of headset (because waiting in headset is boring), so join that ahead of trying to jump into the Battle > Duel queue, and announce when you're ready to play.

review_title: This is my favourite VR game!
one_reviews_text:
I love this game! Honestly, it’s brilliant and I play a quick session every time I put on my headset. 

The spells are intuitive, each class offers a distinctive style of play, it’s both strategic and action packed. There’s an amazing feeling of immersion that comes with game mechanics like this, and standing in these arena tossing spells around is one of the best experiences I’ve ever had in VR. Actually, the first time I summoned the “Ferris wheel spider” is still my top moment in VR.

The single player mode is great (if a little short) but you can’t skip the dialogue so replaying levels gets annoying. That said, I’m on my fourth play through now, so can’t be that bad.

A good PvP when you match up against someone on your skill level is for me, the most fun I’ve had in VR. There’s something really exhilarating and moreish about a closely matched game that reminds me of the countless hours I put into Streetfighter as a kid.

The game is primarily a multiplayer game, and I will say that sadly this long after launch it’s hard to get a game unless you go through the discord group (who are fantastic btw). These guys have really made me feel welcome and definitely helped me engage with this awesome game.

The Discord community actually deserves its own 5* review and is worth a mention here. There are regular weekly events for all skill levels and the more advanced players are only too happy to give tips and help newer players advance. There are some great casual players in the mix as well, so you don’t need to invest hours in skills to have a great time.

For me personally, it is soooo close to perfect. As it is, this is really a 4 1/2* review, but If they introduced a Street Fighter style single player tournament mode, or a wave based arena mode just to flesh out the solo options this would definitely be the best game on the platform (imo).

review_title: SCARED OF HEIGHTS?  I CERTAINLY WAS!!!!!
one_reviews_text:
I rarely write reviews, perhaps because I rarely agree with reviews I even bother to read.  But I wanted to point out one thing that nobody seems to mention about this game which I think is incredibly impressive/immersive:

Lots of the game is played on roof tops.  And at least to me, I legitimately got very very very SCARED about the height.  I literally was having trouble physically looking around because I was so scared.  Admittedly, this sounds ridiculous but I tried over several days (each time thinking I was just being silly), but nope... I really felt SCARED about the height issue.  For this reason alone, I'd definitely recommend this game.  I've watched countless movies and played countless games in my lifetime but NEVER can I remember ever being SCARED and could barely move.

As for the game itself.. It was nicely done.. not necessarily my cup of tea because I always prefer to physically dodge (step left/right) to avoid bullets instead of teleporting/shield...   but via the FEAR of being so high and the impressive graphics, I'd definitely recommend this game.  Honestly, even if the game did allow me to move around, I embarrassingly wouldn't be able to because I'm telling you... I was friggin' scared!!  (PS:  In real life, I'm in my 40s and have in fact gone sky diving, bungee jumping and hot air ballooning.  I have *NO* idea why this game scared me soooooo much about the height but it did..  and that is indeed incredible!).  I do NOT see anybody else talking about the height issue so perhaps it was just ME (and I'm just a big baby), but I felt it certainly deserves mention and praise.  :)

Quite frankly, I cannot think of ANY other game or movie that I've ever seen in my entire life where I literally would not want to teleport to the top of the building because I would be SCARED about the height (despite the top of the building being a better location to shoot the bad guys).  How ridiculous and/or cool is that!?

Job well done.  :)

review_title: One of the best Oculus games I've played
one_reviews_text: Absolutely fantastic game. Can be a bit hard to grasp at first, but after about an hour or two you'll be almost unstoppable. Fantastic way to show off what VR can do.

I usually don't write reviews (due to being lazy), but this game really deserves it.  The graphics are outstanding (as good as robo recall).  the game play itself is very fun and feels natural.  The 5 classes in the game provides a decent variety which you would definitely find atleast one class you'll like.  The game is centered around PVP (even though it has a new single player campaign if you don't like pvp).  The PVP of the game is fun although I'm new and get beaten by high rankers all the time ( my advice: DON'T BE AFRAID TO LOSE, YOU'll GET BETTER EVENTUALLY).  For example, at first I can't even damage the high rank players who are good, but after a day playing I was able to win a few rounds against high rankers (I'm a quick learner :P).  I especially enjoy the combat, because it isn't just about mindlessly throwing spells at other players.  You actually figure out strategies to win (which spell to use, when to use shield, and when to dodge, etc). 

The Biggest and Only problem with this game IMO is the fact that there are not enough players when it comes to rank matching.  It takes a long time to find a match, but luckily they have a active discord community where you could just get the discord app and ask for matches, simple, right? Here is a invite link https://discord.gg/fVanwbv

I do hope the developers would add some variety to the solo duel npc like have a npc of each class to solo duel with (I don't need it now but it would had been nice when I was unfamiliar) so people would have a feel to how to deal with each class when playing them in rank without having to get stomped by high rankers first to get the experience XD.

Overall, I would highly recommend buying this game for $20, it's well worth the price.

Lastly, developers you did a great job at making this game!  I look forward to more updates and content in the future! :D

review_title: One of the best titles for VR to date
one_reviews_text:
One of the very few games I've played that feels like a polished, complete AAA game rather than an indie project. Graphics are great, the storyline is pretty good, the environments are fantastic and particularly unique and compelling, and the combat is satisfying and fun. Progression can be achieved both through multiplayer or singleplayer, and unlocks access to new artifacts (special abilities) and classes, which are all completely unique (no reskins or anything of the like). 

My only criticism, and it is very minor, is that while the tracking works great in first-person, it looks fairly 'off' from other perspectives. That is, watching another player (or yourself in the mirror) doing a particular gesture or motion doesn't really look like it should - but you'll rarely notice this anyway.

I explained that they did not list that in the system requirements and that I could not get a refund from Oculus because I had played the game for 3 hours prior to the crash.  They said I was basicaly out of luck.  At the time of this writing they have still not updated thier system requirements and will not refund me.   DO NOT buy this game if you are not running Windows 10!

**EDIT**  Since my review and emails to the game makers they added Windows 10 to the system requirements and have tried to be very helpful, although I was unable to get a refund. review_title: Great game; needs more to do

Firstly, I'd like to say the experiences this game offers are superb! The graphics are stunning, and it really does make you feel like a wizard. I just wish it lasted a bit longer, or had a bit more to do. There are 3 different classes to play with and a couple different abilitys to unlock; but you can unlock all of these within an hour or so of gameplay and from then on I've found it to become rather repetitive and somewhat boring. Also - it only offers multiplayer battles; and sometimes you can end up waiting 5+ minuites for an opponent to battle. I would recommend this game for the experiences it offers; but if you are looking for a game to provide hours and hours of gameplay I would look elsewhere.


Edit: The Arcane Update is excellent! This gives me confidence the developers will be continually adding new spells and maps, which should allow the game to last a lot longer. One of my main problems has also been fixed - and this is the main reason I will now continue to play the game; they've given you something to do while waiting for your opponent! You can shoot at red targets. Its amazing how much such a small addition really can change the game. I'm no longer like "Oh no, stood there for 5 minutes doing nothing" whenever my cursor hovers over The Unspoken.


Edit 2: Just recieved their second update. It seems to be heading towards a new update every month, which is great news! It really is promicing to see a team of active developers releasing such amazing and well-thought out updates so often. I have boosted my rating up to 5 stars. If you own Oculus Touch then this game is a must-have. I am really looking forward to future updates, especially after seeing the sneak-previews they released on their website in December, there are some truly great things in store for us! (You can visit their update preview page here: https://www.insomniacgames.com/unspoken-arcane-updates/)
